an6.117:1.1: “Mendicants, without giving up these six qualities you can’t meditate observing an aspect of the body.
an6.117:1.3: Relishing work, talk, sleep, and company, not guarding the sense doors, and eating too much.
an6.117:1.4: Without giving up these six qualities you can’t meditate observing an aspect of the body.
an6.117:2.1: But after giving up these six qualities you can meditate observing an aspect of the body.
an6.117:2.3: Relishing work, talk, sleep, and company, not guarding the sense doors, and eating too much.
an6.117:2.4: After giving up these six qualities you can meditate observing an aspect of the body.”
